alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 12:18PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Montgomery and Bath Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms around the Sharpsburg area, or 10 miles north of Mount Sterling, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Sterling, Owingsville, Marshall, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Sharpsburg, Salt Lick, Clay Lick, Preston, Reynoldsville, Sideview, Peasticks, Walkers Crossing, Moore`s Ferry, Flat Creek, Coons Station, Odessa, Stepstone, Bean and Bourbon Furnace. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 129. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief, very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
